text:
The video feed — and the power to control it — was once a real lever of power in Congress. As a newcomer to the House in 1979, Newt Gingrich used C-SPAN to regularly blast Democrats before cable subscribers https://politi.co/2HuykBv

text:
In June 1978, the House voted to retain internal control of the cameras. Nine months later, the live telecasts began — carried then, as now, by C-SPAN. 

Gavel-to-gavel coverage of the Senate, carried by C-SPAN, began in 1986.
